snippet: The remarks by Ayatollah Ali Khamenei may have been intended to strengthen Iran’s position at the negotiations.
abstract: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader, denounces United States as negotiations to conclude interim nuclear agreement resume; Khamenei cites range of grievances he says illustrate American hostility toward Iran and Muslim world; remarks may be intended to strengthen Iran's position in negotiations.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and THOMAS ERDBRINK
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Thomas Erdbrink from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The remarks by Ayatollah Ali Khamenei may have been intended to strengthen Iran’s position at the negotiations.

headline.main: As Iran Nuclear Talks Resume, Ayatollah Criticizes U.S.
headline.print_headline: As Iran Nuclear Talks Resume, Ayatollah Criticizes U.S.
